page.title: 18NORTON BARRACKS.
page.content: The Barracks were built between January 1875 and September 1876 on 25 acres of land purchased from the Earl of Coventry. As well as officers' quarters, there was accomodation for 224 single and 32 married soldiers. The papers called it 'Norton Military Depot'. The depot expanded during the late 19th century and became the home of the Worcestershire Regiment. One side effect on the village of Norton is that many of the soldiers married villge girls and settled there after army life. The barracks closed down in the 1970's. The grounds surrounding the Barracks are currently used as a sports ground, but the buildings are left derilict although there are plans to convert them into a luxury hotel.
